title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

First point:

The response needs to identify x=7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI3aaaaa@3616@ (and no other x-values). This can be done by presenting an ordered pair but in this case, the y-coordinate must be correct.

The following responses would earn the first point:

· x=7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4naaaa@35F6@

· ( 7,  12 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AB9@

The following responses would not earn the first point:

· ( 7,  0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39FC@

· x=−1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaeyOeI0IaaGymaiaacYcaaaa@378D@ x=7, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4naiaacYcaaaa@36A6@ x=8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGioaaaa@35F7@

Second point:

The justification must discuss g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaaaaa@342A@ changing from positive to negative at x=7. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4naiaac6caaaa@36A8@

The point cannot be earned for just stating that g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaaaaa@342A@ changes sign or changes at x=7. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4naiaac6caaaa@36A8@

Note: Only referencing “the slope” or “the derivative” is too ambiguous to earn the point.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The response needs to apply the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.

Here are some examples that earn the first point:

· ∫ 0 7 g ′  ( x )  dx = g ( x )  |  0  7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4F81@

· g ( x )  |  0  7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4084@

· g ( 7 )−g ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DC5@

The first point would not be earned for ∫ 0 7 g ( x )  dx = g ( x )  |  0  7 =g ( 7 )−g ( 0 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5B9B@

Second point:

The response must use the values of g ( 7 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3819@ and g ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3812@ to earn this point.

This response earns both points: g ( 7 )−g ( 0 )=12−( −16 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45D3@

A response of 12+16 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaGaaGOmaiabgUcaRiaaigdacaaI2aaaaa@3706@ earns the second point, but not the first.

A response of 28 with no supporting work earns no points.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The response must convey that g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaaaaa@342A@ is continuous as a consequence of g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga qbaaaa@344C@ being differentiable.

· “Since g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga qbaaaa@344C@ is differentiable, g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga qbaaaa@344C@ is continuous” or “ g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaaaaa@342A@ is differentiable and therefore continuous” would earn the first point.

If there is no implication involving g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaaaaa@342A@ being differentiable, then the first point is not earned.

· For example: “ g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaaaaa@342A@ is differentiable and continuous” does not earn this point.

Second point:

The response needs to be Yes. Further, the response must reference the MVT either directly or by stating the conclusion of the theorem in words. Since g is twice differentiable, the response does not need to say that g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaaaaa@342A@ is differentiable.

However, the response must reference the continuity of g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaaaaa@342A@ in order to earn this second point. The response must reference the difference quotient (or average rate of change) from the MVT either in words or with an equation.

Here are some examples that earn the second point, but not the first:

· Since g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaaaaa@342A@ is differentiable and continuous, then by the MVT there exists a value c such that is the average rate of change of g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga qbaaaa@344C@ on [ a,  b ]. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B69@

· Since g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga qbaaaa@344C@ is continuous, then there must exist a value c such that g ″ ( c ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga GbamaabmaabaGaam4yaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@36BE@ is the average rate of change of g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga qbaaaa@344C@ on [ 0,  7 ]. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B17@

· Since g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga qbaaaa@344C@ is continuous, then there must exist a value c such that g ″ ( c )= g ′  ( 7 )− g ′  ( 0 ) 7−0 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga Gbamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWGJbaacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaa a8aabaWdbiqadEgapaGbauaapeGaaGjcVpaabmaapaqaa8qacaaI3a aacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyOeI0Iabm4za8aagaqba8qacaaMi8+aaeWa a8aabaWdbiaaicdaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaa8aabaWdbiaaiEdacqGHsi slcaaIWaaaaiaac6caaaa@4653@

These responses do not earn any points in part (c):

· Since g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga qbaaaa@344C@ is continuous then yes.

· Yes, by MVT.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First two points:

These two points may be awarded in either order, or simultaneously.

We must see g ( x 3 −1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AD1@ for the FTC point and 3 x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3614@ for the chain rule point. If there is a g ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3812@ present as part of the derivative of h or in the calculation of h ′  ( 2 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38B1@ then the FTC point is not earned.

Examples:

· h ′  ( x )=g ( x 3 −1 ) ⋅ 3 x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49E7@ earns the FTC point and chain rule point.

· g ( x 3 −1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B4E@ earns the FTC point but not the chain rule point.

· g ( x 3 −1 )−g ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@411A@ does not earn either point.

· g ( x 3 −1 ) ⋅ 3 x 2 −g ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4969@ earns the chain rule point but not the FTC point.

Third point:

To be eligible for this point, the response must have already earned both the FTC point and the chain rule point. In addition, the response must use the value of g ( 7 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38AB@ Answer must be our answer.

There is an alternate version of the FTC that is correct: g ( x 3 −1 ) ⋅ 3 x 2 −g ( 0 ) ⋅ 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4FA6@ would earn at least the first two points.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Both of these responses earn this point:

· A ( x )=x ⋅  g ′ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadgeaca aMi8+aaeWaaeaacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyypa0JaamiEa8aa caaMe8+dbiabgwSixlaaysW7ceWGNbGbauaadaqadaqaaiaadIhaai aawIcacaGLPaaaaaa@4335@

· x ⋅  g ′ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhapa GaaGjbV=qacqGHflY1caaMe8Uabm4zayaafaWaaeWaaeaacaWG4baa caGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3D52@

Some responses give the formula for A ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGbbGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@380F@ indirectly. In this situation, the connection must be clear and correct.

This response earns the point: ∫ 0 7 A ( x )  dx = ∫ 0 7 x ⋅  g ′  ( x )  dx . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5784@

These responses do not earn the point:

· ∫ 0 7 x ⋅  g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47FD@

· ∫ 0 7 A ( x )  dx =A ( x )=x ⋅  g ′ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbmaapedapa qaa8qacaWGbbGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiaa ykW7caaMc8UaamizaiaadIhaaSWdaeaapeGaaGimaaWdaeaapeGaaG 4naaqdcqGHRiI8aOGaeyypa0JaamyqaiaayIW7daqadaqaaiaadIha aiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqpcaWG4bWdaiaaysW7peGaeyyXICTaaG jbVlqadEgagaqbamaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@521E@

If the correct expression is used in part (f) but is never shown in part (e), the response does not earn this point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The integration by parts point is earned for correctly performing integration by parts regardless of the limits of integration (those are part of the answer point). This is like an “indefinite integration by parts” point. Details of the u ⋅  v ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadwhapa GaaGjbV=qacqGHflY1caaMe8UabmODayaafaaaaa@3AD8@ decomposition are not required.

Here are some example of responses that earn the first point:

· ∫ 0 7 x  g ′ ( x )  dx = x g ( x ) |  0  7 − ∫ 0 7 g ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbmaapedapa qaa8qacaWG4bGaaGjbVlqadEgagaqbamaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjk aiaawMcaaiaaykW7caaMc8UaamizaiaadIhaaSWdaeaapeGaaGimaa WdaeaapeGaaG4naaqdcqGHRiI8aOGaeyypa0ZaaqGaaeaacaWG4bGa aGjbVlaadEgacaaMi8+aaeWaaeaacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaaG jcVdGaayjcSdWaa0baaSqaaiaayIW7caaIWaaabaGaaGjcVlaaiEda aaGccqGHsisldaWdXaWdaeaapeGaam4zaiaayIW7daqadaqaaiaadI haaiaawIcacaGLPaaacaaMc8UaaGPaVlaadsgacaWG4baal8aabaWd biaaicdaa8aabaWdbiaaiEdaa0Gaey4kIipaaaa@61DE@

· ∫ x  g ′ ( x )  dx =x g ( x )− ∫ g ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbmaapeaapa qaa8qacaWG4bGaaGjbVlqadEgagaqbamaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjk aiaawMcaa8aacaaMc8UaaGPaV=qacaWGKbGaamiEaaWcbeqab0Gaey 4kIipakiabg2da9iaadIhacaaMe8Uaam4zaiaayIW7daqadaqaaiaa dIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGHsisldaWdbaWdaeaapeGaam4zaiaayI W7daqadaqaaiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaapaGaaGPaVlaaykW7peGa amizaiaadIhaaSqabeqaniabgUIiYdaaaa@5653@

Second point:

A numerical answer must be presented, although it does not need to be simplified.

7 ⋅ g ( 7 )−15.4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4234@ does not earn the answer point.

7 ⋅ 12−0−15.4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@406C@ is the minimal computation that must be shown in order to earn both points. If the 0 is missing from this expression, the first point for integration by parts is not earned.

If the response uses an expression from part (e) that was incorrect, then we can read for both points in part (f) only if the integration requires integration by parts.

To be eligible for the answer point the integration by parts point must be earned.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

To earn the first point, the response must convey that both the numerator and the denominator approach 0.

Any response that includes “ limit= 0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AC8@ ” does not earn the first point.

Presentations, such as “ → 0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3701@ ” or “ limit=indeterminate form  0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4BDE@ ” can earn the first point as long as the response does not have “ limit= 0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A6A@ ”.

If the response writes the limit as a quotient and puts an arrow from the numerator to 0 and a separate arrow from the denominator to 0 then the point is earned.

A response can earn the point by evaluating the numerator at x=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaiaacYcaaaa@369F@ and the denominator at x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@35EF@ without limit notation because both the numerator and denominator are continuous functions.

Second point:

The point is earned for attempting to apply L’Hospital’s Rule by differentiating the numerator and the denominator.

The point is not earned for applying the quotient rule.

Errors in differentiating will not earn the answer point.

The second point may be earned even if the limit notation is missing from some expressions, but it cannot be earned if the response never expresses anything we recognize as a limit.

Each of these responses earns the second point:

· lim x→0 g′ ( x )−1 cos x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@481D@

· lim x→0 g′ ( x )−x cos x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@485F@

· lim x→0 g ( x )−x−2 sin x = g ′  ( x )−1 cos x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@55B7@

Note: If the response shown in this last bullet is equated to our answer, the response earns only the second point, because of equating terms that are not equivalent. If the correct answer is given but not set equal to this expression, the response earns the second two points.

Third point:

The answer must be correct. The answer does not need to be simplified, but if it is, it must be correct.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The response must include a correct one-sided limit that defines the improper integral in order to earn this point. Here is an example:

· lim b→ 7 − ∫ 0 b g ″ ( x ) g ′ ( x )   dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWfqaqaaabaaaaaaaaape GaciiBaiaacMgacaGGTbaal8aabaWdbiaadkgacqGHsgIRcaaI3aWd amaaCaaameqabaWdbiabgkHiTaaaaSWdaeqaaOWdbmaapeBab8aaba Wdbmaalaaapaqaa8qaceWGNbGbayaadaqadaqaaiaadIhaaiaawIca caGLPaaaa8aabaWdbiqadEgagaqbamaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjkai aawMcaaaaapaGaaGPaVlaaykW7peGaamizaiaadIhaaSWdaeaapeGa iqeGicdaa8aabaWdbiaadkgaa0Gaay5kIaaaaa@4C73@

Second point:

The point is earned for finding the antiderivative of g ″ ( x ) g ′ ( x ) . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaabaaaaaaaaape Gabm4zayaagaWaaeWaaeaacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaapaqaa8qa ceWGNbGbauaadaqadaqaaiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaaaWdaiaac6 caaaa@3B41@ No limit notation is required and limits of integration do not affect this point. This point can be earned if the first was not earned.

This response earns the second point: ∫ 0 7 g ″ ( x ) g ′ ( x )   dx = ln|   g ′ ( x )  | |  x=0  x=7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbmaapeBab8 aabaWdbmaalaaapaqaa8qaceWGNbGbayaadaqadaqaaiaadIhaaiaa wIcacaGLPaaaa8aabaWdbiqadEgagaqbamaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaay jkaiaawMcaaaaacaaMc8UaaGPaVlaadsgacaWG4baal8aabaGaiqeG icdaaeaapeGaaG4naaqdcaGLRicakiabg2da9maaeiaabaGaciiBai aac6gadaabdaqaaiaayIW7ceWGNbGbauaadaqadaqaaiaadIhaaiaa wIcacaGLPaaacaaMi8oacaGLhWUaayjcSdGaaGjcVdGaayjcSdWaa0 baaSqaaiaayIW7caWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaqaaiaayIW7caWG4bGa eyypa0JaaG4naaaaaaa@5C91@

Note that details of the substitution do not need to be provided.

The antiderivative must have absolute values.

Third point:

The point is earned for correctly evaluating the one sided limit of the anti-derivative.

This response earns the third point: lim b→ 7 − ln|   g ′ ( b )  |−ln 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWfqaqaaabaaaaaaaaape GaciiBaiaacMgacaGGTbaal8aabaWdbiaadkgacqGHsgIRcaaI3aWd amaaCaaameqabaWdbiabgkHiTaaaaSWdaeqaaOWdbiGacYgacaGGUb WaaqWaaeaacaaMi8Uabm4zayaafaWaaeWaaeaacaWGIbaacaGLOaGa ayzkaaGaaGjcVdGaay5bSlaawIa7aiabgkHiTiGacYgacaGGUbGaaG jbVlaaiAdaaaa@4C2D@ does not exist.

A response of − ∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaMi8EcaaSamaiJg6HiLcaa@38FE@ earns the point.

Note: If there is no limit in part (h) then the response could only earn the antiderivative point if that is found correctly. It could not earn the first or third points.
